triples.name: C (programming language)
triples.relevance: The paper formalizes the semantics of the C programming language itself.

triples.name: Type system
triples.relevance: The paper develops a formal type system for C as part of its semantics.

triples.name: Operational semantics
triples.relevance: The paper uses structural operational semantics to specify C's dynamic behavior.

triples.name: Higher-order logic
triples.relevance: The paper expresses its formal semantics in higher-order logic notation.

triples.name: HOL (proof assistant)
triples.relevance: The HOL theorem prover is used to verify the consistency of the C semantics definition.

triples.name: Automated theorem proving
triples.relevance: The paper employs theorem proving to prove theorems about C programs.

triples.name: Type safety
triples.relevance: The paper proves type safety for typed C expressions as a key property.

triples.name: Hoare logic
triples.relevance: The paper derives Floyd-Hoare style axiomatic rules for verifying C programs.

triples.name: Formal verification
triples.relevance: The paper provides formal verification tools and case studies for C programs.
